comments.author: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.text:
User Agent:  

Steps to reproduce:

0. Clear cache/restart Fx.
1. Enable webconsole (shift-ctrl-k) and error console (shift-ctrl-j).
2. Open Testcase http://www.vogtner.de/mozilla/680806/ of Bug 680806.
3. Click rapidly on right button more than four times.
4. Press shift reload.
5. Click rapidly on right button.


Actual results:

- Error console shows "Error: Image corrupt or truncated".
- Web console shows 
  "Image corrupt or truncated" and
  [undefined ...]


Expected results:

- Error console does not show errors.
- Web console does not show errors.
- Images are not fetched from server more than once after shift-reload.
(all as after step 3.)
comments.creator: kdevel@vogtner.de

4. Press shift reload.
5. Click rapidly on right button.


Actual results:

- Error console shows "Error: Image corrupt or truncated".

Expected results:

comments.author: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.text:
(In reply to Kevin Brosnan [:kbrosnan] from comment #1)
> Not a Fennec (Firefox mobile) bug

Oops. OS is Linux and hardware is x86_64
comments.creator: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Kevin Brosnan [:kbrosnan] from comment #1)
> Not a Fennec (Firefox mobile) bug

Oops. OS is Linux and hardware is x86_64

In "Actual results:" is missing:

A GET request is performed for every assignment to img's src attribute (images seem no to be cached after shift-reload).

comments.raw_text:
Setting status to new. Reproducible using the steps provided in Comment 0. The issue is also reproducible on x86. The "Image corrupt or truncated" error was displayed after step 4 and 6. 

The following is the regression for the web console showing "Image corrupt or truncated":

Last good nightly: 2010-12-20
First bad nightly: 2010-12-21

Pushlog:
http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=fc50c521bf48&tochange=fb629ae54510
